fields.description: ShuffleHandler (map output file) and SpillRecord (index file) are reading file using unsecured input stream. There exists a possibility for symlink attack. related to YARN-578 . Creating this issue to track map reduce changes.
fields.summary: SpillRecord and ShuffleHandler should use SecureIOUtils for reading index file and map output

comments.body: this is tracking map reduce changes
File ownership will be verified for both index file and map output file.
Can you also write a simple test for validating secure access for the index as well as the output? Tx.

Adding test for SpillRecord. Can not test ShuffleHandler.
Adding krb5.conf file as it is required for the test case.

{color:green}+1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12582214/MAPREDUCE-5208-20130507.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 2 new or modified test files.

I prefer a more edge test - can we instead create the index file and invoke a shuffle HTTP URL and make sure we get an error in case of invalid files?

Updating test case. Testing ShuffleHandler using HTTP request. Updating error message sent by the server. Instead of just sending "ERROR ON SERVER" now sending all wrapped exceptions. Avoiding explicitly to send the whole stack trace.
